titleStmt.title: The proceedings against Mr. J. Reading who being found guilty of high misdemeanours, was fined to the King in one thousand pounds, to suffer one years imprisonment, and to stand three several days in the pillory, at three several places; and of his usage by the people, and his deportment in the pillory. With other remarkable circumstances. With allowance.

The proceedings against Mr. J. Reading who being found guilty of high misdemeanours, was fined to the King in one thousand pounds, to suffer one years imprisonment, and to stand three several days in the pillory, at three several places; and of his usage by the people, and his deportment in the pillory. With other remarkable circumstances. With allowance.

notesStmt.note: Caption title on p. 3 reads: The proceedings against Mr. Reading, &c.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
